articles.title: February 20, 1986: Silvio Berlusconi officially becomes the owner of Milan
articles.summary: On 20 February 1986, Silvio Berlusconi officially became the owner of Milan after having signed ten days earlier, following a negotiation aimed at saving the Rossoneri from a possible bankruptcy that seemed around the corner ...

articles.title: Galliani says: "Did Berlusconi follow Milan even after the sale? When Pioli was there, he asked me to call him: he challenged the construction from the bottom and gave him technical suggestions"
articles.summary: On the day that marks the 40th anniversary of Silvio Berlusconi purchasing Milan (20 February 1986), Adriano Galliani gave a long interview to Corriere della Sera in which he said that the former Rossoneri president ...

articles.title: Corsport headlines: "Inter, Lautaro out for 20 days. Calf knocked out: no derby"
articles.summary: The Corriere dello Sport on newsstands this morning has the front page headline: "Inter, Lautaro out for 20 days. Calf knocked out: no derby".

articles.title: The opening of the Gazzetta: "Milan in a frenzy. The club irritated with the referees calls the AIA"

articles.title: Galliani: "For Berlusconi, Milan was an act of love. Without him we would never have won 29 trophies in 31 years"
articles.summary: February 20th is always a special day for the Rossoneri colors because we remember what happened in 1986, that is, the passage of Milan from Giussy Farina to Silvio Berlusconi, giving rise to an unrepeatable cycle.

articles.summary: After the draw against Como, Milan will return to the pitch on Sunday at 6pm at San Siro against Parma, in the match valid for the 26th matchday of Serie A.

articles.summary:
